page.title: 01THE AREA AROUND WALKINGTON.
page.content: THE AGRICULTURAL NATURE OF OUR AREA MEANS THAT MOST DATA IS CONCERNED WITH THE ONLY POPULATED PART,THE VILLAGE OF WALKINGTON.3 MILES TO THE EAST IS THE COUNTY TOWN OF BEVERLEY;10 MILES SOUTH EAST IS THE CITY OF HULL.THESE TWO CENTRES PROVIDE FACILITIES NOT PRESENT IN A VILLAGE OF 1850 PEOPLE,AND ARE ALSO THE MAJOR AREA OF EMPLOYMENT. A VERY PRETTY,SELECT AREA IS MARRED BY A THROUGH ROAD AND TRAFFIC TO THREE PUBS.NEW ESTATE HOUSING IS ALSO SPOILING THE RURAL CHARACTER.FOLK WOULD LIKE MORE FACILITIES AND BUSES BUT MAINLY THE YOUNG AND OLD USE THEM. ALTHOUGH WITHOUT ANY MAJOR FACILITIES THE VILLAGERS HAVE MANY SOCIAL EVENTS, CLUBS AND SOCIETIES. A VILLAGE IN A PLEASANT RURAL AREA IS QUICKLY BECOMING A SMALL "TOWN",MINUS THE SERVICES TO COPE AND MUCH TO THE ANGER OF LONG_STANDING RESIDENTS.
